intro: Acianthera bicarinata, commonly known as the two-ribbed orchid, is a species of orchid native to South America. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil. Acianthera bicarinata is a terrestrial orchid that is often found in forest understories.
